data.meta_description: This fragment, probably copied in the 6th century, is part of a folio, probably from a manuscript of the Acts and Epistles, containing part of the Epistle of James. It is written in the Biblical majuscule script typical of the period. The text has been partially washed off, perhaps in preparation for use in a palimpsest, but no replacement text was ever added. Dr Christopher Wright
data.text:
Westminster College

This fragment, probably copied in the 6th century, is part of a folio, probably from a manuscript of the Acts and Epistles, containing part of the Epistle of James. It is written in the Biblical majuscule script typical of the period. The text has been partially washed off, perhaps in preparation for use in a palimpsest, but no replacement text was ever added.
